deregistered with the Electoral Commission on 19 December 2017. === Ankit Love === Love calls himself the "Maharaja of the sovereign state of [[Jammu and Kashmir]]" and is the son of [[Bhim Singh (politician)|Bhim Singh]] and [[Jay Mala]], the founders of the [[Jammu and Kashmir National Panthers Party]] of [[India]],{{Cite news|url=http://www.thelondoneconomic.com/news/homeless-mp-candidate-shut-saudi-qatari-brunei-embassies-westminster/02/06/|title=Homeless MP candidate would 'shut down' Saudi, Qatari and Brunei embassies in Westminster|last=Peat|first=Jack|date=2 June 2017|work=The London Economic|access-date=20 July 2018|language=en-GB}} a socialist party opposed to [[Islamic terrorism]]. He was born in 1983{{Citation|last=One Love Party|first=|title=Ankit Love on London Live TV. End Air Pollution Pandemic Now!|date=26 April 2016|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=545N4qrTm18|volume=|pages=|access-date=20 July 2018}} and grew up in Shimla, but was moved to Surrey in 1989 for security reasons, given the political engagements of his family. He later studied art and music in Surrey and California. At the age of 24, Love was expected to take over his father's political party, but he refused to do so, given his father's former connections with [[Saddam Hussein]] and [[Muammar Gaddafi]]. Love is a musician and film-maker. Love's short film ''Whale!'' and documentary ''Runners'' premiered at [[Cannes Film Festival]]. Love was also previously a racing car driver and co-founded the fashion brand Nicole Coste. On 24 February 2017, Love announced his candidacy for [[Prime Minister of India]] for the [[Indian general election, 2019|2019 Indian general election]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.outlookindia.com/website/story/prime-minister-modi-to-face-love-challenge-in-2019-lok-sabha-elections/298050|title=Prime Minister Modi To Face Love Challenge In 2019 Lok Sabha Elections|last=Ganai|first=Naseer|date=24 February 2017|work=[[Outlook India]]|access-date=31 March 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/LondonLive/status/836553724759724034|title=London Live on Twitter|last=|first=|date=28 February 2017|website=Twitter|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=21 July 2018}} Love joined the Jammu and Kashmir National Panthers Party. He became the party's leader on 28 May 2017.{{Cite web|url=http://www.jkmedia.net/featured/ankit-love-33-is-the-new-leader-of-the-panthers-party-of-india/|title=Ankit Love, 33 is the New Leader of the Panthers Party of India {{!}} JK Media News|last=|first=|date=|website=JK Media News|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=1 June 2017}} His announced policies including sending the first woman to Mars, and tackling air pollution in India. In the build-up to the [[United Kingdom general election, 2017|2017 UK general election]], Love joined the [[Liberal Democrats (UK)|Liberal Democrats]] based on their opposition to [[Brexit]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/new-indian-faces-likely-in-britain-s-house-of-commons/story-Q0eQosgm4N3jm7IeyGJUiM.html|title=New Indian faces likely in Britain’s House of Commons|last=Sonwalkar|first=Prasun|date=3 May 2017|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|access-date=1 June 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}} In the 2017 general election, Love stood as an independent candidate in the [[Cities of London and Westminster (UK Parliament constituency)|Cities of London and Westminster constituency]] using the title "The [[Maharaja]] of [[Kashmir]]".{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/politics/constituencies/E14000639|title=Cities of London & Westminster parliamentary constituency - Election 2017|last=|first=|date=|work=BBC News|access-date=1 June 2017|language=en-GB}}{{cite web|url=https://www.westminster.gov.uk/sites/www.westminster.gov.uk/files/statement_of_persons_nominated_cities_of_london_and_westminster.pdf|title=Statement of Persons Nominated 2017|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=[[Westminster City Council]]|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=12 May 2017}} By the time of the election, he was registered homeless and living on the streets. He came second to last with 59 votes, winning 0.2% of the total vote. On 18 August 2017, Ankit Love attended a Panthers Party campaign rally at [[Baramulla district|Barmulla district]] in Jammu and Kashmir.{{Cite news|url=http://www.5dariyanews.com/news/202219-Ankit-Love-and-Prof-Bhim-Attacked-By-Al-Qaeda-Terrorists-in-Kashmir|title=Ankit Love and Prof. Bhim Attacked By Al-Qaeda Terrorists in Kashmir|last=Pampori|first=Rouf|date=2018-08-19|work=5 Dariya News|access-date=2018-07-26}} At the rally he called for the abolition of [[Article 35A of the Constitution of India|Article 35A]], and the reunification of India and Pakistan to stop the threat of an “apocalyptic nuclear war for Kashmir.”{{Cite web|url=http://greaterjammu.com/2017/08/13/ankit-love-returns-to-kashmir-with-a-dream-to-reunite-india-pakistan-by-referendum/|title=Ankit Love returns to Kashmir with a dream to reunite twenty-two Indian army guards, survived an armed attack by [[Al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent|Al-Qaeda]] terrorists, in which his father, [[Bhim Singh (politician)|Bhim Singh]], was wounded. == Policies == The party described itself as "techno-progressive".{{Cite news|url=https://www.hackneycitizen.co.uk/2016/09/05/dawa-ma-one-love-candidate-hackney-mayoral-election/|title=Meet the candidates for Hackney Mayor: Dawa Ma, One Love|last=Loeb|first=Josh|date=9 May 2016|work=Hackney Citizen|access-date=19 October 2016|via=}} The party proposed legalising, licensing and taxing drugs such as [[Cannabis (drug)|cannabis]] in the hope of ending the war on drugs and reducing violent crime.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenationalstudent.com/National/2016-05-04/free_university_and_legal_drugs_meet_ankit_love_the_london_mayoral_candidate_you_ve_never_heard_of.html|title=Free university and legal drugs: meet Ankit Love, the London mayoral candidate you've never heard of|last=Miller|first=Lucy|date=4 May 2016|work=The National Student|access-date=20 October 2016|via=}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.oneloveparty.eu/end-war-on-drugs/|title=End War on Drugs|last=|first=|date=|website=One Love Party|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=20 October 2016}} Love claimed that the prohibition of drugs "was originally based on racism, and it funds all the criminal activity in our society." During the London mayoral campaign, it proposed to do this through municipality-owned licensed dispensaries.{{Cite news|url=http://europe.newsweek.com/mayor-london-polish-prince-ankit-love-456864?rm=eu|title=What's it like to run for Mayor of London?|last=Lowe|first=Josh|date=6 May 2016|work=[[Newsweek]]|access-date=20 July 2018|via=}} The party called for a [[People's Vote|vote on the final Brexit deal]], which would have enfranchised citizens of the [[European Union]] resident in the United Kingdom and 16- and 17-year-olds. Because EU citizens could not vote in it, the party claimed that the [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum, 2016|Brexit referendum]] was illegal, violating the [[Treaty of Lisbon|Lisbon Treaty]] and the [[European Convention on Human Rights]].{{cite web|url=http://www.pakistanchristianpost.com/detail.php?communityid=487|title=NPP Chief appeals Hackney electorate to vote One Love Party in Mayor By-Election|last=|first=|date=9 September 2016|website=Pakistan Christian Post|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=21 October 2016}} During the London mayoral election campaign, the party endorsed [[Terry Farrell (architect)|Terry Farrell]]'s proposal to build six new bridges across the [[River Thames]] in order to boost the regeneration of East London and provide 47,000 homes.{{Cite web|url=http://www.riverthamesnews.com/News934.html|title=One Love Party candidate Ankit Love's policies for the Thames|last=|first=|date=|website=River Thames News|publisher=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=18 June 2018}} The party also pledged to introduce "discount travel cards for Londoners"{{Cite news|url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/news/west-london-news/what-11-things-one-love-11172808|title=Mayoral elections: 11 things the One Love Party want to change|last=Joshi|first=Amita|date=14 April 2016|work=getwestlondon|access-date=18 July 2018}} and make higher education free for London residents up to phD level. During the Tooting by-election campaign, Love favoured bringing the [[Crossrail 2|Crossrail 2 line]] through [[Tooting Broadway tube station|Tooting Broadway]] and voiced his opposition to [[High Speed 2|HS2]]. === Environment === The One Love Party's priority issue was [[air pollution]], which it described as a [[pandemic]] situation, quoting figures that 50,000 people die from it annually in the UK.{{Cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/world/a-kashmiri-dogra-who-wants-to-be-mayor-of-london/story-4zu6gLKKDsVa5fpH4mtysJ.html|title=A Kashmiri Dogra who wants to be mayor of London|last=Sonwalkar|first=Prasun|date=27 April 2016|newspaper=[[Hindustan Times]]|access-date=20 November 2016|via=}} It campaigned for immediate emergency action to bring fossil fuel emissions to zero by the [[Civil Contingencies Act 2004]] and [[Royal prerogative in the United Kingdom|Royal Prerogative]] to force all power production, shipping, aviation and automobile companies to convert to only clean energy sources. The party pledged to ban all cars except electric and hydrogen vehicles.{{Cite web|url=https://www.hackneycitizen.co.uk/2016/10/26/hackney-central-masterplan-resurrecting-hackney-brook-ideas-feedback/|title=Reborn river among weird and wonderful ideas as council invites masterplan feedback|last=Loeb|first=Josh|last2=Schöffmann|first2=Katharina|date=26 October 2016|website=Hackney Citizen|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=11 November 2016|last3=Eckersley|first3=Max}} Love had previously called for the [[British Armed Forces|army]] to organise a military coup d'état and overthrow [[David Cameron]], then the [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]], on the issue of air pollution. In an interview with ''[[London Live (TV channel)|London Live]]'', Love expressed his long-term intention to decommission power stations using fossil fuels across the UK. During the London mayoral election campaign, the party called for a ban on all fossil fuel emissions vehicles from the capital and wanted to introduce [[Autonomous car|driverless]] electric cars for public transport.{{Citation needed|date=July 2018}} Love called for the city's [[List of cycle routes in London|cycle superhighways]] to be suspended from the railway network. The party would have converted all [[water vessel]]s from [[bunker fuel]] to [[hydrogen fuel]], solar or [[SkySails]]. The party also pledged to increase the use of driverless electric vehicles, reduce the cost of installing solar panels in residential homes, adopt electric and hydrogen-powered buses, scrap the [[Garden Bridge]] project, cancel the [[Silvertown Tunnel|Silvertown tunnel]] project, revive the Thames' eel population and investigate the potential of new moorings. Love also called for adverts for cars to be banned in the same way as adverts for cigarettes. During the Hackney mayoral by-election campaign, the party called for a monument to remember the victims of air pollution akin to a war memorial. === Technology === In agreement with its techno-progressive philosophy, the party supported the expansion of drones, driverless cars, robotic technology and artificial intelligence, stating that these would make more efficient use of scarce resources even if they increased unemployment. The One Love Party believed in an accelerated program of space exploration, including the [[colonization of Mars|colonisation of Mars]] and [[Colonization of Venus|Venus]] and the [[Asteroid mining|mining of asteroids]] to mitigate economic scarcity. They had pledged to establish a London municipal space program to detect unknown asteroids on a collision course with Earth.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dazeddigital.com/artsandculture/article/31007/1/the-ex-mtv-sensation-aiming-to-be-london-s-pro-weed-mayor|title=The ex-MTV sensation aiming to be London’s pro-weed mayor|last=Kirkinis|first=Andreas|date=5 May 2016|work=[[Dazed]]|access-date=20 July 2018|via=}} By applying robotic technology and [[artificial intelligence]], the party wished to abolish personal income taxes and introduce a [[Basic income|universal basic income]] for all citizens.{{Cite web|url=http://www.oneloveparty.eu/manifesto/|title=Manifesto|last=|first=|date=|website=One Love Party|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=20 October 2016}} During the London mayoral election campaign, the party pledged to introduce [[Li-Fi]] networks{{Cite news|url=http://www.southwarknews.co.uk/news/9249-2/|title=MAYORAL ELECTION: candidates for UKIP and the One Love party layout their plans for London - Southwark News|last=|first=|date=4 May 2016|work=|newspaper=Southwark News|access-date=18 July 2018|language=en-GB|via=}} and use maintenance drones to oversee roadworks and street and building repairs. Love said that he wanted London to be the first major city "to have driverless cars on an everyday basis." === Housing market === During the London mayoral election campaign, the party pledged to build one million social homes in four years. They pledged to achieve this by constructing skyscrapers akin to quick-build flatpack buildings in [[China]] on land owned by [[Transport for London]] and the [[Greater London Authority]]; the building would have been funded by bank loans and private financing. At the same time, the party said it would outlaw purchases of new apartments for buy-to-let or investment purposes. === International relations === The party proposed a confederate economic union for India, [[Pakistan]], [[Bangladesh]] and China, akin to that of the European Union, which would have included free movement of labour and a single currency, with the aim of ending the "potential of an apocalyptic nuclear war". Love [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum, 2016|supported]] the United Kingdom's continued membership of the European Union. == Electoral performance == {| class="wikitable" |+Summary {{Intelligent Design}} '''Ontogenetic depth''' is a [[pseudoscientific]] idea proposed in February 2003 by [[Paul Nelson (creationist)|Paul Nelson]], an American philosopher of science, [[young earth creationism|young Earth creationist]] and [[intelligent design]] advocate;<ref>{{cite book | author = Numbers, Ronald L. | authorlink = Ronald Numbers | title = The creationists: from scientific creationism to intelligent design | edition = | language = | publisher = Harvard University Press | location = Cambridge | year = 2006 | origyear = | isbn = 0-674-02339-0 | page = 606 }}</ref> he is employed by the [[Discovery Institute]].
Basically, Nelson concludes in his 'hypothesis' that developmental complexity is [[wikt:infrangible|infrangible]], and that if he shows [[Cambrian]] organisms to be complex, then it is therefore impossible for them to have evolved.<ref name='discussion paper'>{{citation | first1 = Paul A. | last1 = Nelson | first2 = Marcus | last2 = Ross | contribution = Ontogenetic Depth and the Origin of Animals | title = ISCID Online Biology Chat Discussion Paper | date = 5 February 2003 | contribution-url = http://www.iscid.org/nelsonchat.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate = 2011-03-27 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.iscid.org/encyclopedia/Ontogenetic_Depth | title = Ontogenetic Depth | accessdate = 2011-03-27 | author = Paul Nelson | year = 2003 | publisher = ISCID Encyclopedia of Science and philosophy | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110514135558/http://www.iscid.org/encyclopedia/Ontogenetic_Depth | archive-date = 2011-05-14 | dead-url = no | df = }}</ref> Nelson proposes '[[Ontogeny|ontogenetic]] depth' as evidence of [[specified complexity]], and a reliable marker of design by an intelligent agent, in opposition to [[modern evolutionary theory]].
Nelson subsequently stated that ontogenetic depth is "Currently Impossible to Measure".<ref>[http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2011/04/10/paul-nelson-takes-a-stab-at-on/ Paul Nelson takes a stab at Ontogenetic Depth again…which makes me go stab-stab-stabbity-stab] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140408213822/http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2011/04/10/paul-nelson-takes-a-stab-at-on/ |date=2014-04-08 }}, by [[PZ Myers]], at [[Pharyngula (blog)|Pharyngula]]; published April 10, 2011. Retrieved April 7, 2014</ref>
== Criticism == Biologist [[PZ Myers]], who works in the field of [[evolutionary developmental biology]], dismissed the concept, stating in 2010 that "Nelson is a creationist who made up this wacky claim of "ontogenetic depth", saying he had a way of objectively measuring the complexity of the developmental process in organisms with a number that described the distance from egg to adult. Unfortunately, he forgot to tell us how one calculated this number, or how it actually accounted for the complexity of a network, or even how we'd get a number that was different for a sponge and a cat. But he did say he'd get back to us with the details tomorrow...six years ago."<ref name='PZ Myers'>{{cite web | url = http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2010/04/happy_monkey_paul_nelson_its_b.php | title = Happy Monkey, Paul Nelson! It's been six years now | accessdate = 2011-03-27 | author = [[PZ Myers]] | publisher = [[Pharyngula]] | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20111113071404/http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2010/04/happy_monkey_paul_nelson_its_b.php | archive-date = 2011-11-13 | dead-url = no | df = }}</ref> Myers concludes that "ontogenetic depth is a sloppily-defined concept with no theoretical support for its validity and no apparent operational utility."<ref>{{cite web | url = http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2008/04/07/ontogenetic-depth/ | title = Ontogenetic depth | accessdate = 2013-02-22 | author = [[PZ Myers]] | publisher = [[Pharyngula]] | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20131022130553/http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2008/04/07/ontogenetic-depth/ | archive-date = 2013-10-22 | dead-url = no | df = }}</ref>
The concept of 'ontogenetic depth' has not been published in any [[peer-reviewed journal]], there are no methods described that would allow to measure this value in any organisms, nobody other than Nelson and his collaborator, Marcus Ross, do anything with the idea.<ref name='PZ Myers' />

{{distinguish|pantachy|pentarchy}} '''Pantarchy''' is a social theory proposed by [[Stephen Pearl Andrews]] in the 19th century. Andrews was considered the "American rival of [[Auguste Comte|Comte]]," because of his work on an all-encompassing philosophy of [[universology]], and his political proposals had similar scope, combining elements of the individualist anarchism of [[Josiah Warren]], whose works Andrews had edited, with a strong belief in natural hierarchy.<ref>Daniel Dorchester. ''Christianity in the United States''. Cincinnati: Phillips and Hunt, 1888. 834; Stephen Pearl Andrews. ''Constitution or Organic Basis of the Pantarchy''. New York: Baker and Godwin, 1860.</ref>
:The plan of this party proposes a NEW SPIRITUAL GOVERNMENT FOR THE WORLD, called THE PANTARCHY, which includes a NEW CHURCH and a NEW STATE, with, to use his own language, " all other subordinate institutions, educational, informational, &c., which are universal in their scope and nature, and which can be devised and established as subservient to the collective wants of mankind." <ref>Daniel Dorchester. ''Christianity in the United States''. Cincinnati: Phillips and Hunt, 1888. 834.</ref>
Andrews scheme of pantarchy was discussed in a series of "Weekly Bulletins" in the pages of ''[[Woodhull & Claflin's Weekly|Woodhull and Claflin's Weekly]]''. The American Section 12 of the [[International Workingmen's Association]] adopted some of Andrews' proposals.

[[List of parliamentary constituencies in Northern Ireland|(NI Seats)]] |seats3 = {{Composition bar|0|18|hex={{People Before Profit/meta/color}}}} |seats4_title = [[Local government in the Republic of Ireland]] |seats4 = {{Composition bar|12|949|hex=#660000}} |seats5_title = [[Local government in Northern Ireland|Local Government (NI)]] |seats5 = {{Composition bar|1|462|hex=#660000}} |seats6_title = [[European Parliament]] (Republic of Ireland) |seats6 = {{Composition bar|0|11|hex=#660000}} }} '''People Before Profit''' ('''PBP''') is a [[Socialism|socialist]] political party formed in October 2005. It is active in both the [[Republic of Ireland]] and [[Northern Ireland]]. ==History== PBP was established in 2005, primarily by members of the [[Socialist Workers Network|Socialist Workers Party]] (SWP).{{cite web|url=http://www.clririshleftarchive.org/organisation/254/|work=Irish Left Archive|title=About Socialist Workers' Network|accessdate=16 April 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.socialistworkeronline.net/about-the-swp/|title=About the SWP|work=Socialist Worker online|accessdate=16 April 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.irishtimes.com/opinion/harry-mcgee-people-before-profit-and-the-anti-austerity-alliance-spot-the-difference-1.2384459|work=The Irish Times|author=Harry McGee|title=People Before Profit and the Anti Austerity Alliance - spot the difference|quote=For anybody who has not been intimately involved with the Socialist Workers Party or the Socialist Party, you would need to have a PhD in semantics and rhetoric to winkle out the actual ideological difference between them. They are both Trotskyist and advocate permanent revolution and political agitation through working class mass action in capitalist societies such as Ireland.|date=9 October 2015|accessdate=16 April 2018}} The Community & Workers Action Group of south Dublin (CWAG) joined the group in 2007 and brought along the party's first elected representative, [[Joan Collins (politician)|Joan Collins]], an [[Anti-Bin Tax Campaign|anti–bin tax]] campaigner and former member of the [[Socialist Party (Ireland)|Socialist Party]].[http://www.indymedia.ie/newswire.php?story_id=64445 The Socialist Party, Joan Collins and the Bin Tax Battle] An analysis by Dermot Connolly, ex Secretary of the Socialist Party In the opinion of [[Harry McGee]], an opinion writer for the [[Irish Times]] newspaper, the organisation is Trotskyist.{{cite web|url=https://www.irishtimes.com/opinion/harry-mcgee-people-before-profit-and-the-anti-austerity-alliance-spot-the-difference-1.2384459|work=The Irish Times|author=Harry McGee|title=People Before Profit and the Anti Austerity Alliance - spot the difference|quote=For anybody who has not been intimately involved with the Socialist Workers Party or the Socialist Party, you would need to have a PhD in semantics and rhetoric to winkle out the actual ideological difference between them. They are both Trotskyist and advocate permanent revolution and political agitation through working class mass action in capitalist societies such as Ireland.|date=9 October 2015|accessdate=16 April 2018}} ==Republic of Ireland== PBP contested several constituencies in the [[Irish general election, 2007|2007 general election]], polling around 9,000 [[first preferences]], with [[Richard Boyd Barrett]]—the candidate in the [[Dún Laoghaire (Dáil constituency)|Dún Laoghaire constituency]]—missing a seat on the 10th and final count by 7,890 votes to 9,910.{{cite web|url=http://www.rte.ie/news/elections2007/results/constit-22.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=28 May 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070818183706/http://www.rte.ie/news/elections2007/results/constit-22.html |archivedate=18 August 2007 }}{{cite web|url=http://electionsireland.org/candidate.cfm?ID=4256 |title=Ciaran Cuffe |website=ElectionsIreland.org |date= |accessdate=19 May 2016}} In May 2008, PBP [[Twenty-eighth Amendment of the Constitution Bill 2008|launched a campaign]] calling for a No vote on the [[Treaty of Lisbon|Lisbon Treaty]] when it was put to the people.{{cite web |url=http://archive.peoplebeforeprofit.ie/node/156 |title=Lisbon Treaty is unchanged and must be rejected | People Before Profit Alliance |website=Archive.peoplebeforeprofit.ie |date= |accessdate=19 May 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160604231511/http://archive.peoplebeforeprofit.ie/node/156 |archivedate=4 June 2016 |df=dmy-all }} In the Republic's [[Irish local elections, 2009|2009 local elections]] PBP ran twelve candidates, including ten in County Dublin. It secured five seats in three of Dublin's four councils. As well as ten members of the SWP, [[Joan Collins (politician)|Joan Collins]] and Pat Dunne of the CWAG ran in Dublin,{{cite web|url=http://electionsireland.org/candidate.cfm?ID=6163|title=Pat Dunne|work=ElectionsIreland.org}} and Donnie Fell (a former [[Waterford Crystal]] worker and trade union representative) in Waterford.{{cite news|first=Olivia|last=Kelly|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/breaking/2009/0507/breaking70.htm|title=Left alliance to run 13 candidates|newspaper=[[The Irish Times]]|date=7 May 2009|accessdate=7 May 2009}} In the Republic's [[Irish general election, 2011|2011 general election]], both Richard Boyd Barrett and Joan Collins were elected to [[Dáil Éireann]] as TDs (deputies), running under a joint People Before Profit and [[United Left Alliance]] banner. In April 2013 [[Joan Collins (politician)|Joan Collins]] TD and Cllr Pat Dunne left the group to form [[United Left (Ireland)|United Left]], a political party with former Socialist Party TD [[Clare Daly]]. In the May 2014 local elections, PBP won 14 seats including two seats outside Dublin on Sligo and Wexford County Councils. Discussions were held in August 2015 with the [[Anti-Austerity Alliance]] about forming a new political grouping.{{cite news|url=http://www.thejournal.ie/anti-austerity-alliance-people-before-profit-2259896-Aug2015/|title=Could we be about to get another new political group?|work=TheJournal.ie|date=8 August 2015}} On 17 September 2015, the two parties announced they had formally registered as a single political party for electoral purposes.{{cite news|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/news/politics/anti-austerity-alliance-and-people-before-profit-to-launch-new-party-1.2353674|title=Anti Austerity Alliance and People before Profit to launch new party|work=The Irish Times|date=17 September 2015}} The new organisation was called the [[Anti-Austerity Alliance–People Before Profit]]. At the [[Irish general election, 2016|2016 general election]], Boyd Barrett was re-elected.{{cite web|url=https://electionsireland.org/result.cfm?election=2016&cons=113|title=Dún Laoghaire – General Election: 26 February 2016|work=ElectionsIreland.org}} He was joined by fellow PBP candidates [[Gino Kenny]] and [[Bríd Smith]].{{cite web|url=https://electionsireland.org/result.cfm?election=2016&cons=95|title=Dublin Mid West – General Election: 26 February 2016|work=ElectionsIreland.org}}{{cite web|url=https://electionsireland.org/result.cfm?election=2016&cons=103|title=Dublin South Central – General Election: 26 February 2016|work=ElectionsIreland.org}} ==Northern Ireland== People Before Profit unsuccessfully ran one candidate, Sean Mitchell, in the [[Northern Ireland Assembly election, 2007|2007 Northern Ireland Assembly election]], polling 774 first preferences in the [[Belfast West (Assembly constituency)|Belfast West constituency]]. He successfully gained the right to stand in an election by threatening to take the then [[Secretary of State for Northern Ireland]], [[Peter Hain]], to court if the legal loophole preventing him from doing so was enforced. (England, Scotland and Wales had secured the right to contest candidates under the age of 20, providing they were over 18, for constituencies for devolved government, whereas Northern Ireland had been simply excluded).{{Citation needed|date=July 2008}} People Before Profit ran four candidates in the [[Northern Ireland Assembly election, 2011|Northern Ireland Assembly election of May 2011]], winning 5,438 first-preference votes between them but no seats in the new Assembly. Its most successful candidate in this election was [[Eamonn McCann]], who won 3,120 first-preference votes, or 8% of the total, in [[Foyle (Assembly constituency)|Foyle]]. In the June 2011 [[Belfast West by-election, 2011|Belfast West by-election]], [[Gerry Carroll (politician)|Gerry Carroll]] won 1,751 votes (7.6%), coming in third place and ahead of both unionist candidates. In the [[Belfast City Council election, 2014|2014 Belfast City Council election]], Gerry Carroll became the first PBP councilor elected in Northern Ireland, winning 3rd place in the [[Black Mountain (District Electoral Area)|Black Mountain DEA]], with 1,691 1st Preference votes. In May 2016, Carroll]] topped the poll in the [[Belfast West (Assembly constituency)|Belfast West]] constituency at the [[Northern Ireland Assembly election, 2016|2016 Assembly Election]] with 8,299 votes (22.9%), almost 4,000 first-preference votes clear of his nearest challenger, [[Sinn Féin]] MLA [[Fra McCann]] (Sinn Féin was running five candidates).{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/politics/northern-ireland-constituencies/N06000004 |title=Belfast West - Northern Ireland Assembly constituency - Election 2016|publisher=BBC News|date=6 May 2016|accessdate=19 May 2016}} This victory secured PBP with their first elected MLA. [[Eamonn McCann]] also took a seat in the Derry constituency of [[Foyle (Assembly constituency)|Foyle]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/politics/northern-ireland-constituencies/N06000008 |title=Foyle - Northern Ireland Assembly constituency - Election 2016 |publisher=BBC News |date=7 May 2016|accessdate=19 May 2016}} In [[Northern Ireland Assembly election, 2017|2017]], Carroll retained his seat but with a much reduced vote (12.2%),{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/politics/northern-ireland-constituencies/N06000004 |title=Belfast West - Northern Ireland Assembly constituency - Election 2017 |publisher=BBC News |date=3 March 2017 |accessdate=3 March 2017}} while McCann lost his.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/politics/northern-ireland-constituencies/N06000008 |title=Foyle - Northern Ireland Assembly constituency - Election 2017 |publisher=BBC News |date=3 March 2017 |accessdate=3 March 2017}} In the Northern Ireland Assembly, the party is designated as neither [[Unionism in Ireland|unionist]] nor [[Irish nationalism|Irish nationalist]], but 'Other'. ===2016 EU Membership referendum=== People Before Profit supported and campaigned for a Leave vote in the [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum, 2016|2016 EU referendum]].{{cite web|url=http://www.irishnews.com/opinion/letterstotheeditor/2016/07/04/news/brexit-fallout-has-undermined-the-principle-of-consent-586751/|title=Brexit fallout has undermined the principle of page.title: Revolutionary Agrarian Movement of the Bolivian Peasantry

revision.text:
The '''Revolutionary Agrarian Movement of the Bolivian Peasantry''' ([[Spanish language|Spanish]]: ''Movimiento Agrario Revolucionario del Campesinado Boliviano'', MARC) was a [[right-wing]] [[Christian]] [[nationalist]] movement in [[Bolivia]].
The Revolutionary Agrarian Movement of the Bolivian Peasantry was established by General [[René Bernal Escalante]] and [[José Zegarra Cerruto]] among the [[Cochabamba Department|Cochabamba]] campesinos in June 1978. <ref>Political parties of the world. Longman, 1988. P.70.</ref>
In 1978 the MARC took part in an electoral coalition [[Popular Alliance for National Integration]] backing René Bernal Escalante as the presidential candidate and [[Mario Gutiérrez Gutiérrez]] (FSB) as the vice-presidential candidate. <ref>Elections in the Americas : a data handbook / ed. by Dieter Nohlen, Vol. 2. [Oxford] [u.a.]: Oxford Univ. Press, 2005. P.151.</ref>
After the coup d'état on 17 July, 1980 the Revolutionary Agrarian Movement of the Bolivian Peasantry disappeared.
==Notes== {{reflist}} [[Category:Defunct political parties in Bolivia]] [[Category:Nationalist parties in Bolivia]] [[Category:Political parties established in 1978]] [[Category:Christian political parties]] [[Category:Agrarian parties]]

{{Use Australian English|date=September 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Tony Briffa | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = 1971 | birth_place = [[Altona, Victoria]], Australia | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | residence = Altona, Victoria, Australia | education = | other_names = | occupation = | known_for = First known intersex mayor, intersex activist and educator | television = ''60 Minutes'' (2005){{cite web|url=http://sixtyminutes.ninemsn.com.au/webchats/263855/hes-the-man-tony-briffa|title=60 Minutes|publisher=[[Nine Network]]|accessdate=7 December 2013}}
''7.30 Report'' (2013) | website = {{URL|www.briffa.org}} }} '''Tony Briffa''' (born Antoinette Briffa in [[Altona, Victoria|Altona]], Victoria) is an [[Australian people|Australian]]-[[Maltese people|Maltese]]{{Cite news| last = Calleja| first = Claudia| title = ‘Healthy hermaphrodite’ is both man and woman| work = [[Times of Malta]]| location = Malta| date = 16 February 2015| url = http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150216/local/-Healthy-hermaphrodite-is-both-man-and-woman.556257}} who has [[Partial Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome]]. Briffa is an independent councillor, and former mayor and deputy mayor in the [[City of Hobsons Bay]], Victoria{{cite web | url = http://www.hobsonsbay.vic.gov.au/Council/Mayor_and_Councillors/Councillor_Tony_Briffa_JP | title = Councillor Tony Briffa JP, Cherry Lake Ward | accessdate = 14 February 2014}} Briffa is considered the world's first openly [[intersex]] mayor and public office-bearer. Briffa was raised as a girl, then lived for a time as a man, and now chooses to live as both female and male.{{cite web| url = http://www.abc.net.au/7.30/content/2013/s3798646.htm | title = Living outside 'male or female' | work = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] 7.30 Report | date = 8 July 2013}}{{cite web | url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fFtXJOIxtPQ | title = Animation: NICHE IDAHO Campaign: "I", Tony (YourStory) Video animation | work = NICHE}} Briffa is one of the first people to be public about a chosen blank, indeterminate, birth certificate. == Early life == Tony Briffa was born with [[Partial Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome]], raised as a girl and castrated at age seven to impose that [[assigned sex]] of rearing. Speaking to a 2013 [[Senate of Australia]] inquiry into the ''Involuntary or coerced sterilisation of intersex people in Australia'', Briffa describes how doctors "convinced my mother to approve me to be castrated": {{quotation|"I have a few pages here from my medical records...It says: 'Mother now ready for gonadectomy.' ... The histology reports, which I will also tender, show that they were healthy testes. But there was no Family Court approval. If we are talking about coercion, doctors coerce families, parents, into believing by saying: 'We need to remove these testes because it will make your child normal'... Of course, part of the whole sterilisation thing is that you have pretty big surgery and scars, so they are making you different! ... [and surgery is] usually over the summer holidays, so your summers are spent in hospital".{{cite web | url = http://www.aph.gov.au/Parliamentary_Business/Committees/Senate/Community_Affairs/Involuntary_Sterilisation/Sec_Report/index | title = Involuntary or coerced sterilisation of intersex people in Australia | publisher = [[Australian Senate]] Community Affairs Committee | date = October 2013}}}} == Career == Tony Briffa is the world's first openly [[intersex]] public mayor, and "the first known intersex public office-bearer in the Western world",{{cite web | url = http://www.starobserver.com.au/news/briffa-to-march-in-mayoral-robes/67497 | title = Briffa to march in mayoral robes | work = [[Star Observer]] | date = 8 December 2011}} serving as Deputy Mayor of the City of Hobsons Bay, Victoria, between 2009 and 2011, and Mayor between 2011–2012.{{cite web | url = http://www.advocate.com/news/daily-news/2011/12/09/intersex-mayor-elected-australia | title = "Intersex Mayor Elected in Australia" | work = [[The Advocate (LGBT magazine)|Advocate.com]] | date = 9 December 2011}}{{cite web | url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/12/10/tony-briffa-intersex-mayor_n_1140840.html | title = "Tony Briffa Of Australia's City Of Hobsons Bay Becomes World's First Intersex Mayor" | work = [[The Huffington Post]] | date = 10 December 2011}}{{cite web | url = http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/worlds-first-intersex-mayor-cr-tony-briffa-does-not-want-to-be-called-he-or-she/story-e6frf7jo-1226621092313 | title = World's first intersex mayor, Cr Tony Briffa does not want to be called he or she | work = [[Herald Sun]] | date = 15 April 2013}}{{cite web | url = http://www.samesame.com.au/news/7737/Melbourne-elects-Australias-first-intersex-Mayor.htm | title = Melbourne elects Australia's first intersex Mayor | work = SameSame.com.au | date = 9 December 2011 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20131110040518/http://www.samesame.com.au/news/7737/Melbourne-elects-Australias-first-intersex-Mayor.htm | archivedate = 10 November 2013 | df = dmy-all }}{{cite web | url = http://www.rawstory.com/rs/2011/12/10/australia-elects-worlds-first-intersex-mayor/ | title = Australia elects world’s first intersex mayor | work = The Raw Story | date = 10 December 2011}} Briffa resigned as a local councillor on 14 February 2014, effective on the appointment of a successor.{{cite web | url = http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/victoria/intersex-exmayor-of-hobsons-bay-tony-briffa-calls-it-quits/story-fni0fit3-1226827021307 | title = Intersex ex-mayor of Hobsons Bay Tony Briffa calls it quits | work = [[Herald Sun]] | date = 14 February 2014}}{{cite web | url = http://briffa.org/resignation-announcement | title = Resignation Announcement | publisher = Cr Tony Briffa | date = 14 February 2014}} In October 2016, Briffa was re-elected to Hobsons Bay City Council.{{cite web|url=https://www.vec.vic.gov.au/Results/Council2016/HobsonsBayResult.html|title= Hobsons Bay City Council election results 2016 | date = 29 October 2016 | work = Victorian Electoral Commission}} Tony Briffa has previously served as the President of the Genetic Support Network of Victoria. Briffa is now co-executive director of [[Intersex Human Rights Australia]] (formerly OII Australia){{Cite web| last = Carpenter| first = Morgan| title = We are now "Intersex Human Rights Australia"| work = Intersex Human Rights Australia| accessdate = 31 March 2018| date = 4 March 2018| url = https://ihra.org.au/31878/new-ihra/}} and vice-president of the [[Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome Support Group Australia]];{{cite web | url = http://ihra.org.au/information/board/ | title = Our Board | work = [[Intersex Human Rights Australia]] | date = 12 October 2013}} described as "the two leading groups advocating for the rights of intersex people in Australia".{{cite web | url = http://www.darwinoutgames.com.au/index.php/conference/keynote-speakers | title = 3rd Asia Pacific Outgames Human Rights Forum – Keynote Speakers | work = [[Outgames]]}} === Selected bibliography === * {{Cite news| last = Briffa| first = Tony| title = Proud intersex person Tony Briffa tells story of self discovery| work = [[News Corp Australia]] | date = 8 September 2014 | url = http://www.news.com.au/lifestyle/real-life/proud-intersex-person-tony-briffa-tells-story-of-self-discovery/story-fnixwvgh-1227051164954}} * {{Cite journal| last = Briffa| first = Tony| title = Tony Briffa speaks at the Darwin Outgames Human Rights Forum| location = Darwin| date = 15 May 2014 | url = http://oii.org.au/25290/darwin-outgames-human-rights-forum/}} * {{Citation| last = Briffa| first = Tony| title = Tony Briffa writes on "Disorders of Sex Development"| date = 8 May 2014 | url = http://ihra.org.au/26808/tony-briffa-on-dsd/}} * {{Cite journal| doi = 10.1038/428695a| volume = 428| pages = 695| last = Briffa| first = Tony| title = Intersex surgery disregards children’s human rights| journal = [[Nature (journal)|Nature]] | date = 15 April 2004 | url = http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v428/n6984/full/428695a.html| pmid=15085107}} * Parts of Briffa's life story are depicted in a short online animation. == Personal life == === Birth certificate === [[Norrie May-Welby]] is popularly regarded as the first person with an indeterminate birth certificate, and "non-specific" sex was awarded by the High Court of Australia in April 2014 on the basis of May-Welby's failed sex affirmation surgery.{{cite court |litigants=NSW Registrar of Births, Deaths and Marriages v Norrie |vol=2014 |reporter=HCA |opinion=11 |pinpoint=11 |court=High Court of Australia |date=2 April 2014 |url=http://www.austlii.edu.au/au/cases/cth/HCA/2014/11.html}} However, Tony Briffa had previously obtained a birth certificate with a blank sex classification.{{cite web | url = http://briffa.org/about | title = About Tony | work = Briffa.org | date = 2012}}{{Citation | title = Involuntary or coerced sterilisation of people with disabilities in Australia: Thursday 28 March 2013 | location = Canberra | date = 28 March 2013 | last1 = [[Senate of Australia]] | last2 = Community Affairs References Committee | url = http://www.aph.gov.au/hansard }}{{cite web | url = http://gaynewsnetwork.com.au/news/national/tony-briffa-to-wed-partner-in-nz-ceremony-12022.html | title = OII VP Tony Briffa to wed partner in NZ ceremony – Gay News Network | work = [[SX News|Gay News Network]] | date = 27 September 2013 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170103013232/http://gaynewsnetwork.com.au/news/national/tony-briffa-to-wed-partner-in-nz-ceremony-12022.html | archivedate = 3 January 2017 | df = dmy-all }} [[Alex MacFarlane]] is believed to be the first.{{cite web | url = http://www.bodieslikeours.org/pdf/xmarks.pdf | title = X marks the spot for intersex Alex | work = West Australian | publisher = bodieslikeours.org | date = 11 January 2003}}{{cite journal | url = http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/09505430802280784?journalCode=csac20#.Un8OUZFw1cc | first = Ingrid | last = Holme | title = Hearing People's Own Stories | journal = Science as Culture | volume = 17 | issue = 3 | doi = 10.1080/09505430802280784 | date = 2008 | pages=341–344}}{{cite web | url = http://www.smh.com.au/nsw/neither-man-nor-woman-20100626-zaye.html | title = Neither man nor woman | work = [[Sydney Morning Herald]] | date = 27 June 2010}}{{cite journal | url = http://www.asanet.org/sectionsex/documents/SUMMER03sexnews.pdf | title = Newsletter of the Sociology of Sexualities Section of the American Sociological Association | work = American Sociological Association Sexualities News | volume = 6 | issue = 1 | date = Summer 2003}}{{cite web | url = http://oii.org.au/21597/ | title = Ten years of ‘X’ passports, and no protection from discrimination | work = [[Organisation Intersex International Australia]] |date = 19 January 2013}} Speaking to the Senate hearing on intersex sterilisation in March 2013, Briffa said: {{quotation|My birth certificate, from the state of Victoria, does not classify me as male or female. I have certainly had a female birth certificate, I had a male birth certificate at one stage and I have a blank birth certificate now. But we are hoping that one day in the future our birth certificates will actually be able to reflect, for those who want it, the way nature made us. If people feel female that is great, and if they feel male that is great, but there are also people like me: I just accept the way nature made me. I am happy for my birth certificate to say that I am both male and female. One day, hopefully, we will have that as well.}} === Pronouns === Briffa made the following statement: "I am very public about being born biologically partially female and partially male and that I was raised as a girl and lived as a woman until I was 30. I ask all my friends and colleagues to respect my sex as what nature made me; both female and male." On his website Briffa posted:
“I feel very comfortable having accepted my true nature. I am not male or female, but both. I am grateful for the years I lived as a woman and the insight and experiences it gave me. I am still ‘Antoinette’ and have now also incorporated and accepted my male (‘Anthony’ or ‘Tony’) side. I feel whole. I’ll continue to live as Tony but I feel I am now at a point in my life where I can celebrate being different.”{{Cite news|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/12/10/tony-briffa-intersex-mayor_n_1140840.html|title=Tony Briffa Of Australia's City Of Hobsons Bay Becomes World's First Intersex Mayor|date=2011-12-10|work=Huffington Post|access-date=2017-10-04|language=en-US}}
He also added that now that he has come to accept the male part of himself, he is now using male pronouns however continue to identify as neither male or female. === Marriage === Legal issues presented by Tony Briffa's non-specific birth certificate meant that Briffa could not lawfully marry in Australia until late 2017. On 27 September 2013, Tony Briffa married Manja Sommeling in [[Dunedin]], New Zealand.{{cite web| url = http://www.samesame.com.au/features/10308/Tony-and-Manjas-little-Kiwi-wedding.htm | work = SameSame.com.au | date = 8 October 2013 | title = Tony and Manja's little Kiwi wedding}}{{cite web | url = http://gaynewsnetwork.com.au/news/national/tony-briffa-to-wed-partner-in-nz-ceremony-12022.html | title = OII VP Tony Briffa to Wed Partner in NZ Ceremony | work = Gay News Network | date = 27 September 2013 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170103013232/http://gaynewsnetwork.com.au/news/national/tony-briffa-to-wed-partner-in-nz-ceremony-12022.html | archivedate = 3 January 2017 | df = dmy-all }} Intersex Human Rights Australia notes:{{cite web | url = http://oii.org.au/23608/congratulations-tony-manja/ | title = Congratulations, Tony and Manja! | work = [[Organisation Intersex International Australia]] | date = 27 September 2013}}{{Cite journal | last = Briffa | first = Tony | author-link1 = Tony Briffa | title = Tony and Manja Briffa speak at marriage equality rally in Melbourne, 16 August 2014 | location = Melbourne | date = 16 August 2014 | url = http://oii.org.au/27633/marriage-equality-senate-hearing-rally/ }} {{quotation| Tony was born in Victoria with Partial Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome (PAIS), one of many intersex variations, and Tony's birth certificate does not state a sex. Marriage in Australia is currently only permissible between a man and a woman, and Tony is not eligible. Tony is able to marry in New Zealand because legislation providing marriage equality was passed earlier this year. Tony has had to declare an "indeterminate" gender for the purposes of today's marriage.}} == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.briffa.org Tony Briffa website] *[http://www.hobsonsbay.vic.gov.au/Council/Mayor_and_Councillors/Councillor_Tony_Briffa_JP Hobson's Bay Council web page] *{{facebook|CrTonyBriffa}} *{{twitter|@tonybriffa}} *[http://ihra.org.au Intersex Human Rights Australia] *[http://www.aissga.org.au Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome Support Group Australia] {{DEFAULTSORT:Briffa, Tony}} [[Category:Australian people of Maltese descent]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Intersex people]] [[Category:Intersex rights activists]] [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Australian activists]] [[Category:LGBT mayors of places in Australia]] [[Category:Mayors of places in Victoria (Australia)]] [[Category:Intersex rights in Australia]] [[Category:Intersex rights in Malta]] [[Category:Castrated people]] [[Category:People with non-binary gender identities]]
